de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api

Interface ControllableMobAttributes


  • public interface ControllableMobAttributes
    An interface to control attributes of an entity. You can retrieve an instance by using ControllableMob.getAttributes()
    Version:
    v4
    Author:
    Cybran

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Attribute getAttackDamageAttribute() 
      Attribute getKnockbackResistanceAttribute() 
      Attribute getMaxHealthAttribute() 
      double getMaximumNavigationDistance()
      Gets the maximum distance for entity navigation.
      Attribute getMovementSpeedAttribute()
      The default movement speed is 0.7.
      boolean setMaximumNavigationDistance(double distance)
      Defines a maximum distance for entity navigation.

    • Method Detail

      • getMovementSpeedAttribute

        Attribute getMovementSpeedAttribute()
        The default movement speed is 0.7. Default for monsters is 0.25. You should not modify the speed to a value higher than 2.0, or the entity's movement will become unpredictable.
        Returns:
        the movement speed attribute.

      • getAttackDamageAttribute

        Attribute getAttackDamageAttribute()
        Returns:
        the attack damage attribute. Caution: Will return null if the entity is not an attacking entity

      • getMaxHealthAttribute

        Attribute getMaxHealthAttribute()
        Returns:
        the maximum health attribute. Caution: When changing the maximum health, the entity's current health is not scaled or updated

      • getKnockbackResistanceAttribute

        Attribute getKnockbackResistanceAttribute()
        Returns:
        a knockback resistance attribute. Ranged from 0.0 to 1.0, where 1.0 is full resistance (entity will be never knocked back when attacked)

      • setMaximumNavigationDistance

        boolean setMaximumNavigationDistance(double distance)
        Defines a maximum distance for entity navigation. If any target of the entity is further away, the entity will not move. Impacts all aspects of entity movement, whether invoked by ControllableMobActions.moveTo(org.bukkit.Location), ControllableMobActions.follow(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity) or AIAttackMelee (etc.) is not important. Warning: High values or infinite can be very costly (severe CPU load)! To reduce this effect, limit the distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - the new maximum distance for entity navigation (in blocks). The default value is 200 blocks. Ranged from 16 to 2048. Specify 0 to set unlimited.
        Returns:
        true, if the distance was in a valid range.

      • getMaximumNavigationDistance

        double getMaximumNavigationDistance()
        Gets the maximum distance for entity navigation.
        Returns:
        the current maximum distance for entity navigation (in blocks). The default value is 200 blocks.
